final_answer.precision_note: Result given to 3 significant figures, consistent with the input data (23.40 cm3, 0.150 mol dm-3, 25.00 cm3 all to 3 sig figs).

method: First calculate moles of NaOH used: n(NaOH) = c × V = 0.150 mol dm-3 × (23.40/1000) dm3 = 0.003510 mol. From the balanced equation H2SO4 + 2NaOH, the ratio is 1:2, so n(H2SO4) = 0.003510/2 = 0.001755 mol. The concentration of H2SO4 is then c = n/V = 0.001755 mol / (25.00/1000) dm3 = 0.001755/0.02500 = 0.0702 mol dm-3.
checks: Mole ratio check: moles NaOH = 0.00351 mol, divided by 2 gives 0.001755 mol H2SO4, which in 25.00 cm3 gives 0.0702 mol dm-3.
